title: The internet's fight over dinosaur emoji
dc:creator: WBUR
description: Emoji might not be 66 million years old, but they are pretty much everywhere. Join Ben and Amory as they explore the history of dinosaur emoji in LGBTQ+ communities and their more recent use as an online dog-whistle for anti-trans activists. What happens when one symbol is used for conflicting reasons? And can the dinosaur emoji avoid redefinition — or extinction?
itunes:author: WBUR

itunes:subtitle: Emoji might not be 66 million years old, but they are pretty much everywhere. Join Ben and Amory as they explore the history of dinosaur emoji in LGBTQ+ communities and the fight over the emoji's meaning online.

media:content.media:description: Thanks to Dane Grey for this week's artwork. You can find more of their work on Instagram (@danegreyart), or on their Redbubble page (Dane Rex).
